Reviews.Title: “Efficient /clean/friendly....but in the heart of London”
Reviews.Author: RonNYC
Reviews.Content: The Gower House Hotel ( b & b) is located in Bloomsbury. The hotel is undergoing remodelling but did not hinder the stay there. The staff is very friendly and helpful. If you are expecting the Hyatt-Regency, this is not your place. It is clean and efficient...but ideally located within walking distance to the central portion of London. The rooms are clean and on the small size (we had a double) and the breakfast was ordinary. However, the location to the tube (Goodge) and nice atmosphere certainly made it worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Slick007
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on previous guest's reviews. Sure, the facilities are simple, the decor is old (although refurbishments are underway) and the rooms are small with some traffic noise if you are facing the street. But the hotel is basically clean, the beds are comfortable and the staff are very friendly, efficient and helpful. If you want 5* accommodation then don't stay here, but if like me you want a bed for the night close to the west end at a reasonable price, then you could do a lot worse than the Gower House. They provide free shower gels and shampoo, a flat screen TV and tea/coffee facilities in the room, free a cooked breakfast (included in basic room price) and a safe for valuables. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but don't expect too much.”
Reviews.Author: Yooree
Reviews.Content: We didn't expect too much, so overall we had a pleasant stay in the Gower House. It is a budget hotel, however it is located near a subway station (Goodge) and pretty close to some main tourist attractions. The facilities in the room were a bit outmoded, but we found that everyhting was very clean. Breakfast is sober, but sufficient. We'll consider another stay when we are back in London!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location - would certainly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: TAFF0001
Reviews.Content: Hi, enjoyed my stay at your hotel, would definitely consider a stay there in future. Swift check was excellent. Room 12 (on top floor), which I was assigned, was a nice room although, some minor issues - also, I was advised in e-mail, when originally booking, that this room had a nice view - however, this was not the case. Very noisy at night (due to windows being open, because of the hot weather), also the street being constantly busy (and noisy all night - also, the sirens from the emergency services). I was disappointed however on Saturday afternoon, whereby I had to ask at reception for replacement teabags/milk/sugar, etc - the cleaner had been into the room, and tidied the bed (which didn't need much done, as I had already tidied this), but forgot to replenish these items. Also, the table at the side of the bed was holding "old" water below the plastic, which I had to dry with a towel - I am not sure what had happened to this, prior to me having the room. At breakfast yesterday, I did ask for boiled egg and bacon - but only got the boiled egg, so don't know what happened there! Hotel was within easy reach of Tottenham Court Road, Oxford Street, Covent Garden, Soho and many more other places of interest in the centre of London. Also, a short walk from Euston Square Tube Station - if arriving by this means of transport. Also London's King Cross Railway Station.

Reviews.Title: “this place is a dump - unsanitary”
Reviews.Author: nenaghgirl
Reviews.Content: I came with low expectations given the previous reviews but did expect a certain amount of cleanliness which was lacking. Dirty and stained carpets were not vacuumed, and I'm pretty sure we found dried up animal droppings of some sort in the corner. The whole place is tired, worn, and dingy. The beds were terrible, sloping, and you can feel the springs pressing on you all night. The worst element was waking up with several bug bites of unknown origin. The immigrant staff were helpful and kind, but are not the ones in charge unfortunately. One warned us that the hotel is scheduled to be remodeled and so they "did as much as they could." As I said, I wasn't expecting much but a decent standard of cleanliness and care for the guest which was lacking. We checked out 2 nights early - thankful to get out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: DanaToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was always ready to serve/help and even go the extra mile. Location is excellent: tube near by and many points of interest - specially British Museum - in walking distance. It's an old building and could use bathrooms make over but otherwise comfortable and fairly clean. Our room was on the back yard side, good size and very quite. Daily English breakfast was simple but big enough and service prompt and friendly. We were out almost all day so the small TV didn't matter to us. Considering the price I would say you get good enough value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price and staff - OK if you don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: PinkWellies
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gower House Hotel for two nights in April 2011, in a single room with shared facilities, on the top floor of the building. First, the good points: a) The location is fantastic - a short walk from Euston station, very central in London. b) The price is very low for central London (Â£55 p.n. for a single room). c) The staff were excellent - very friendly, helpful and competent, with a very good standard of English. d) I had requested a quieter room when booking, and was given a room at the back of the hotel, which was indeed nice and quiet at night. e) The staff promptly replaced a lightbulb (in the shower cupboard on the top floor) and installed a new roll of toilet paper (in the toilet on the top floor) very soon after being notified about these matters. f) Free wi-fi Internet is available throughout the hotel. Now the less good points: a) The bedrooms were very shabby and not particularly clean (though probably just about adequate), and were rather small. b) The shared toilet on the top floor was in a really tiny cupboard. A large person would probably not be able to use it. (However, there are other shared facilities on other floors, which have much more space). c) There was only one pillow on the bed, and no spare pillow or blanket were provided in the room. The chambermaid provided a second pillow when I requested it, but I found it strange that only one rather thin one was initially provided. d) Although I am able-bodied and had no problems, it should be noted that this is definitely not a hotel for the mobility-impaired: there is no lift, and breakfast is served in the basement. The trek up to the the third (USA: fourth) floor from the basement is a workout in itself. A fellow guest told me that the hotel is in the process of being re-branded to "The Prince of Gower Hotel", and indeed the staff were sporting sweatshirts with that name on. Apparently this will include a complete refurbishing of the rooms - so it may well improve in the near future. All in all, a superbly-located central hotel that is fine for people on a budget who aren't too fussy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, hotel in need of general updating”
Reviews.Author: breo50
Reviews.Content: Price was excellent for four adults, room was generally in need of total updating, clean sheets, and tidy room, but bathroom was not nice at all. Breakfast was average (cheap food). All in all an excellent location and it was a good base and that was all.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, professionally run, good price”
Reviews.Author: danlev
Reviews.Content: Quite good for its class, about as good as the Morgan Hotel, which I left after one night because they had given me a noisy room. At the Gower House Hotel I had a very quiet double room for 85 pounds a night, situated one block from Tottenham Court Road and the Goodge Street Tube stop. The included breakfast was good, the management quite professional. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet & Ideal for laying down your head.”
Reviews.Author: Hepzibar
Reviews.Content: We have found the hotel to be ideal for us as it is value for money and everything you need if you are planning a busy sightseeing holiday. The decor is refreshingly retro but, if your out to impress the latest love of your life try the Savoy. The staff have always been helpful and non intrusive and I woiuldn't hesitate to recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, old and cramped”
Reviews.Author: hxdirect
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location for touring London but it is really really basic. We booked the family room (# 3) for ourselves and our 2 daughters at a rate of Â£120/night. The room would be a good size if it only had the double bed in it but after 2 single beds were added you couldn't swing a mouse in it let alone a cat. 1 of the single beds was plonked just in front of the fireplace which took up the centre of one wall of the room. The other items of furniture shoe-horned in were a rickety pine wardrobe, 2 chairs and a desk/dressing table. The room was far too cramped for us and our luggage. We found the room to be relatively clean and tidy, given there wasn't a lot of floorspace to mess up, but the ensuite facilities are old and in need of a visit from Kim and Aggy to remove some of the ancient limescale and mould. The shower tray was springy underfoot and was so worn in places that the white enamel had disappeared in parts allowing the black underneath to show through. If you want basic accommodation in a good location in London then by all means stay here but it really needs some refurbishment. We think the next time we visit London we may try to book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location , Very Good Choice for Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doctordonnanoble
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to base our London trip, close to 3 tube stops, 1/2 block from a useful bus stop, and steps from the British Museum. Not fancy but clean, comfortable, and pleasant hosts. Be aware that Gower St is a busy road so there is street noise into the evenings. We were OK because it was cool at night and could keep the windows closed. Wifi worked sporadically.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain”
Reviews.Author: wylib
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for luxury accomodations, can't handle steep stairs, or plan to spend a lot of time in your hotel room having an affair or whatever, this is not the place for you. But if you are just looking for a clean, quiet, inexpensive place to sleep in a supurb central London location, close to the Tube and buses and non-touristy shops, this place is hard to beat. From some of the other reviews I thought it might be noisy. I had a street-facing room on the top floor, and from there the traffic sounded very distant (and there wasn't very much of it). What woke me up in the mornings was the sound of birds chirping -- absolutely charming! The walls are thin so if you had noisy neighbors it could be a problem -- but all of my neighbors were quiet and polite (I was the only American there -- the others seemed to be French or Italian, or Brits). The rooms had a hot water heater with tea(hooray!), a telly, and plenty of closet space. Yes, the building is older, but well-kept and clean, and a very typical older London row house (by the time I visited Dickens' house it seemed very familiar!). The staff was very helpful to me, particularly on the first day when I was still fuzzy from my flight. The rooms are small and basic, but who in their right mind is going to go to London to sit in a motel room? The shared bathrooms were close to the rooms. I never had to wait for other people to finish and they were kept so clean I never had a perception that I was sharing them with other people. The breakfast was not gourmet fare but ok, with good coffee (the main thing i care about). My friends were staying at the Generator Hostel. By comparison, I felt I was living in the lap of luxury, and in the end I didn't spend that much more than they did.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there unless you have no other options!”
Reviews.Author: goat27
Reviews.Content: This place has a lot of potential - it's in a good location which is walking distance to covent garden, leicester square etc. We'd also previously stayed in a similar property on the same street (Arran House hotel) and had a great experience. They were booked out this time so we gambled on this hotel, and it was totally different. The entire place needs a make-over. Our room didn't have an ensuite so we had to go up two flights of stairs to the toilet and shower. That shower didn't even work though (I gave up after about 5 minutes of trying to get a temperature that wasn't scalding or freezing, and the hose pipe is broken anyway so most of the water dribbles out before reaching the showerhead. Next time I tried the other shower, which was another couple of floors up, and that was slightly better but still terrible and disgusting with the same leaking pipe issue. All the pipes were rusting, the paint is peeling etc. Our room was just big enough for a double bed against the wall and a sink. The bed was terribly squeaky so you couldn't move without waking your partner. The worst part though was that after staying there, I woke up with about 15 "bites" all over my body. Had checked the room for mozzies before going to sleep and again in the morning, and slept with the window closed, so our best guess was bed bugs or fleas. The staff aren't particularly friendly or nice either. Told the guy about the likely bedbug issues when we checked out and he didn't seem very surprised or apologetic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Everything else, OK”
Reviews.Author: Andrew9
Reviews.Content: Gower House is situated in Bloomsbury. It is a basic budget hotel and in early 2009 cost Â£65 a night for a single room. There didn't appear to be a reception area. Instead you just ring the bell upon arrival and after you're given your room you get a key that opens both the main door into the building which is closed off-hours (from approx. 10.30pm until approx. breakfast time 7.30am) and an indoor hallway door that leads to the rooms. There was a member of staff in the basement on the one occasion I went there off-hours (about 6.30am) so it seems there's always at least one member of staff in the building. (All staff I encountered were friendly). The room itself was very basic. For the price you're not going to get an attractive room in this location. I thought it was a bit cold during the night- it was the middle of winter. The heat came on about 5am and there was usually just enough warm water for washing in the morning - though it sometimes took a while to get that warm water. The room was spacious enough with small colour TV (terrestrial channels), desk, closet, and several lights. Everything was very basic budget quality - the room, bed, shower, bathroom, etc. The main problem with the room was noise from all night traffic on Gower Street, including a bus stop right outside the hotel. I was in a front room so ask for a room facing the back if you're a somewhat light sleeper. There is no lift/elevator but there aren't that many floors and the stairs aren't steep, like in Amsterdam, so it won't be a problem unless you've got mobility issues. Breakfast was served in the basement. You could have bacon & eggs or a poached egg plus cereal, toast, tea and coffee. It was better than most budget hotels I've stayed in. The location is excellent. Gower House is on the same street as the British Museum, close walking distance to many of London's main attractions, and within 10 minutes walk of several Tube stations. There are very few shops on Gower Street itself but nearby (less than 5 minutes walk) Tottenham Court Road has plenty of shops (ie Tesco, Boots, fast food restaurants) and a couple of pubs. Next time I'm in London I'll stay in the same area but Gower House won't be my first choice. That said, it WILL be one of my alternatives if I can't get my first choice. So, overall, I'd recommend it for 'no frills' budget conscious travelers who want to be close to the centre of London but don't want to stay in a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic, convenient location, polite staff”
Reviews.Author: TwoBootz
Reviews.Content: The short description: clean, basic, no frills accommodation reasonably priced, with a good location. Gower House is in an older building, so you may have to carry your luggage up stairs. Something to consider if you have mobility issues. The hotel staff were very accommodating re changing the dates of my stay and also granting my request for a room on the main floor. The room, I had, could easily accommodate 3 people, but they didn't ask me to change rooms when it became busy on the weekend, and charged me the single rate. There was also no problem leaving my luggage until I was ready to leave for the airport the afternoon of my departure. They were even nice enough to extend my checkout time by 30 min. The breakfast, which was included in the price of the room, was simple but ample, bacon, eggs, cereal, coffee and toast. The location is a 10 min walk from the British Museum. A 5 - 10 min walk from Goodge St. Station (which has elevators - very helpful when hauling luggage around), and very close to a variety of restaurants and stores. Boots Pharmacy and Sainsbury were on Tottenham Crt Rd. There are some nice, reasonably priced restaurants near the Museum and also on Charlotte St. A few of the people staying here, seemed to be repeat customers who were working/doing research at the British Museum or University College London. All in all not a bad place to stay. I'd recommend room 1, main floor, at the back of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Place On Gower Street”
Reviews.Author: ivaa
Reviews.Content: [--] I asked on a forum for an inexpensive place that was near the British Museum and Charing Cross Road, and this was suggested. Goodge street is the nearest underground station, and it was simple to get there from Stansted. I really enjoyed my stay here, in room # 1. It was on the ground floor, very quiet as the window faced the back garden, and for one traveler there was lots of room; one bed to sleep in and one for my suitcase. Comfortable bed, TV, scrupoulously clean room, and ensuite bathroom with shower. Helpful and friendly staff. If you want cheap food, there's a Chinese store on Store Street that sells pot noodles and very good maki, and there are also some convenience stores in the same street.
